Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mastoparan-A (natural AMPs; Lys-rich; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (53.33%) toMastoparan-VT6Mol formula: C79H138N19O17, Mol Wt: 1625.061; Mol Ex Coeff: 5550; GRAVY: 0.664.Activity:  Active against Gram+ S. aureus CCRC12652 or CCRC15211 (MIC 32-64 ug/ml), S. xylosus (MIC 2 ug/ml), S. alactolyticus (MIC 12 ug/ml), Gram- C. koseri  (MIC 4 ug/ml), E. coli BL21 or JM109 Amp (MIC 8 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae CCRC10694 (MIC 32 ug/ml), S. Choleraesuis  (MIC 32 ug/ml), S. typhimurium CCRC12947  (MIC 32 ug/ml), V. parahamelytics CCRC10806 (MIC 16 ug/ml), and P.aeruginosa (MIC 192 ug/ml).Structure:  the peptide is helical in 8 mM SDS or 40% TFE (CD).Toxicity:  hRBC: not hemo.lytic (<5%) till 64 ug/ml; <15% hemolysis at 128 uM, HC50 ~ 256 ug/ml. Similar results were obtained using chicken and sheep RBC.Upated 4/2022; 8/2024
Literature Information.Author: Lin CH, Tzen JT, Shyu CL, Yang MJ, Tu WC.2011
Literature Information.Title: Structural and biological characterization of mastoparans in the venom of Vespa species in Taiwan
